citation.article-title: “Candidatus Phytoplasma australiense,” a New Phytoplasma Taxon Associated with Australian Grapevine Yellows

p.s: Description of Candidatus Phytoplasma australiense sp. nov.
Candidatus Phytoplasma australiense (the name Candidatus Phytoplasma aurantifolia has been proposed for the phytoplasma associated with the witches’-broom disease of lime (45))

Candidatus Phytoplasma australiense [(Mollicutes) NC; NA; O; NAS (GenBank number L76865), oligonucleotide sequences of unique regions of the 16S rRNA gene 5'-CGGTAGAAATATCGT-3' and 5'-TTTATCTTTAAAAGACCTCGCAAGA-3', P (Vitis, phloem); M].
